channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A decade after the Bataclan attacks, France is still grappling with how to remember
item.description: In the 2015 attacks, 130 people were killed, including at the Bataclan concert hall. France is still wrestling with how to remember the deadliest atta...

item.title: 'We were gone far too long.' House members reflect on longest shutdown
item.description: The House of Representatives was sent home for the duration of the government shutdown. Members returned to the Capitol Wednesday with a lot on their ...

item.title: Air traffic controllers promised fast shutdown pay, but they've been told that before
item.description: The Transportation Secretary says air traffic controllers will be paid promptly as the government reopens. But after the last shutdown, in 2019, some ...

item.title: Federal special education staff may get their jobs back. But for how long?
item.description: A new deal to end the government shutdown may briefly restore staff to U.S. Education Department offices that had been gutted by layoffs.

item.title: 'Thrilled to be open': Smithsonian and other museums welcome visitors back
item.description: The Smithsonians, National Gallery of Art and other sites that receive federal funding are announcing their reopening plans now that the government sh...

item.title: States scramble to send full SNAP food benefits to millions of people after government shutdown ends
Swiss deploy charm offensive in bid to slash crippling Trump tariffs
item.description: Swiss business leaders appear to have made progress with a private initiative in which reports say they brought gifts to the Oval Office.

item.title: Food insecurity around the U.S. has risen this year, survey finds
item.description: Roughly 14% of U.S. households reported being food insecure between January and October, up from 12.5% in 2024, Purdue University researchers found.

item.title: Death row inmate granted clemency right before his scheduled execution
item.description: Tremane Wood was scheduled to be executed in Oklahoma on Thursday. Gov. Kevin Sitt commuted his death sentence to life imprisonment without parole.

item.title: U.S. reaches trade frameworks with Argentina, Guatemala, El Salvador and Ecuador
item.description: The agreements will likely affect the prices of things like cocoa, bananas and coffee.

item.title: US calls for international action to cut weapons supply to Sudan paramilitaries
item.description: "They're committing acts of sexual violence and atrocities," says the US secretary of state, "and it needs to end immediately".

item.title: Deadly Rio police raid failed to loosen gang's iron grip, residents say
item.description: More than 120 people were killed in the raid which targeted the Comando Vermelho criminal gang.

item.title: Israel receives body Hamas says belongs to hostage
item.description: Confirmation of the remains would mean that only three deceased hostages' bodies now remain in Gaza.

item.title: Blue Origin's New Glenn launches twin Mars probes
item.description: Blue Origin, owned by Jeff Bezos, plans to challenge SpaceX with the powerful, partially reusable New Glenn rocket.

item.title: Trumpâ€™s next immigration crackdown will target Charlotte, North Carolina, a sheriff says
item.description: Charlotte, North Carolina, is the latest U.S. city preparing for a potential immigration crackdown by the Trump administration.

item.title: Germany agrees new military service plan to boost troop numbers
item.description: The new military service plan will mandate all 18-year-old men to fill out a questionnaire on their suitability to serve.

item.title: Emmanuel Clase arrested at JFK, pleads not guilty in pitch rigging case
item.description: Clase and his teammate, Luis Ortiz, are both accused of being involved in a "scheme to rig bets on pitches."

item.title: Airlines are optimistic about a quick recovery ahead of Thanksgiving once the FAA ends flight cuts
